name: Registration and Breakfast
description: Grab a bagel and your badge and meet the other attendees before our sessions kick off!

name: Influencer Marketing Workshop
description:
Digital and social marketing has flipped traditional marketing on its head. Today, everyday people with serious passions for their interests are those with the most power. With their authenticity and credibility, they garner attention of consumers, which is very valuable to brands. 

Even with a closer eye on the relationships between blogger and brand, many content creators have partnered with brands to receive free trips and high value items in exchange for exposure. 

How can you be included in these campaigns? This session will cover six things social influencers can do to get the attention of brands.
speakers: Rob Frasier, George Clintwood, Henry Monteiro

name: Can a mobile-centric social network become the destination?
description: Large social networks seem to still be grasping at straws around their mobile experiences and smaller companies don't seem to have the scale to be considered "the" destination. Is there someone that can satisfy both the needs of users as well as brands?

name: Closing Party
description: Epic closing party with DJ Ante Vukorepa and open bar.

name: Instant Celebrity: What Marketers Need to Know About Digital Media and the Law
description: With the omnipresence of smart phones and the public’s insatiable appetite for celebrity news, what should you know about PR and digital media? This interactive panel will bring together journalists, publicists, and A-list sports and entertainment lawyers to discuss real world case studies, common pitfalls and how to maneuver through this changing landscape.

name: Love Your Brand, Set it Free (Branding in the Digital Age)
description: The social world has shattered the idea of a brand as something that can be controlled. Technology and social media have forever changed relationships between customers, companies and their brands. This session explores branding in the digital age, including how to influence brand perceptions and inspire passionate advocacy for your brand. Learn who really owns your brand, how letting go creates value and why liberated brands succeed.

name: Pinterest for Business
description:
Pinterest has quickly risen to the 3rd most visited site. Businesses are slowly beginning to understand the impact of visual currency and hyper-social sharing.

This panel will uncover real facts, discuss case studies and best practices on how Pinterest may be utilized as a business tactic.

name: How Content is Evolving Digital Media
Digital Startup Founder's Panel
description: The Atlanta Startup / Founder’s Panel aims to take a hard look at our local digital startup scene and discuss what’s working, what’s missing and what can be done to improve things to foster more entrepreneurship and “put us on the map” with other digital startup hubs like Boston, Austin and Silicon Valley. The moderated panel features some of Atlanta’s most prominent and successful digital entrepreneurs, people who not only talk-the-talk but have succeeded where so many others have failed… and who have the scars to prove it. If you’re a busy entrepreneur yourself and have time to attend just one session this week, make it this one and come by to learn, ask questions, and network with some undisputed digital leaders.

name: Blogger Outreach: How to Rally Bloggers to Your Cause
description: Bloggers reach millions of readers every day and often significantly influence their readers. Join presenters from everywhere to learn how to most effectively reach out to bloggers, enlist and enrollthem in your cause and raise awareness about your organization online.

name: The Power of Email Marketing
description:
In just a few an hour, this information-packed seminar will demonstrate how email marketing – the hands-on, low-cost marketing tool – can really help drive business success.
In this session, participants will discover how communicating with customers regularly can help a small business stay connected, and generate increased referrals, repeat sales, and unwavering customer loyalty.

Participants will learn how to start and build a strong permission-based customer list, get their audience to open, read and act on their email, and use their past results to sharpen their email marketing program as they go along.

This practical seminar will provide a concise, but comprehensive overview of how easy it is to create and send professional-looking email newsletters and promotions. Attendees will learn the latest best practices and proven strategies.

Participants will have plenty of time to ask questions, share experiences, and network with peers. And they’ll leave with real-world insights and knowledge that they can put to work immediately, to help their business succeed.

name: The Coming Together of Search & Social
description: There are three main ways social media can have a positive impact on a company's search engine optimization efforts. Conversely, search marketing can influence social media in at least two ways. As the line between search and social continues to blur, come hear Stacy Williams explain how to best leverage these powerful digital marketing tactics in a holistic way.

name: Startup Founders Happy Hour
description: Come early for snacks and giveaways. This is the perfect place to network with other founders and learn from each other.

name: Can We Solve Our Electricity Problem?
Crowdfunding 101: Show me the Money!
description: Crowd sourced funding is changing the way entrepreneurs, entertainers, artists, and non-profits fund their projects. Allison Steele of Baby Robot Industries will present a brief discussion on the impact of crowd funding. Next Lauren Thomas and Dantes Rameau of Atlanta Music Project will share best practices for launching your own campaign. By the end of this session, you’ll have a roadmap with action steps and best practices that you can use to launch your own crowd funding campaign and improve the odds of reaching your goal. The presentation will conclude with a Q + A session with the presenters so bring your ideas and questions to share.

name: Opening Night Party
description: Join us after the conference with the awesome Opening Party shindig. Stay for a few rounds at Meehan's located just across the street.

name: Effective Digital Friendraising
description: Social Media can be an effective way to maintain relationships with the various constituent groups within your community.  Learn about best practices to actively engage your constituents and how to expand your nonprofit’s outreach using social media tools.

name: Creating Content That People Actually Care About
description: So much energy can be spent on building a website or even a robust social media strategy that often the most overlooked aspect is probably the most important ingredient--content. The overused word of 2012 can be daunting and scary but we will dispel the myths of content creation by showing you easy ways to create great looking content.
